text:
With Windows 7 it was “for the one year” so if you started in year 2 you’d have
to buy year 1 and year 2. I would expect this is the same. 
FWIW Server 2012 can actually be upgraded in place to 2016 or 2019 if they are
not looking to replace hardware, and can do that. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/get-started/upgrade-overview
 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/get-started/perform-in-place-upgrade
 
---- 
Steve Yates
ITS, Inc.
%40LV3PR08MB9289.namprd08.prod.outlook.com

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Extended Security Updates for Server 2012R2
metadata.email_text_original:

to buy year 1 and year 2.  I would expect this is the same. 
FWIW Server 2012 can actually be upgraded in place to 2016 or 2019 if they are
not looking to replace hardware, and can do that.
